item.title: I/O multiplexing: select, poll and epoll
item.description: TL,DR. The select() and poll() are system calls to monitor file descriptors. And the epoll is a Linux-specified API to implement I/O multiplexing with higher performance when it comes to large numbers of file descriptors. 1. Why not blocking I/O? Under the convensional file I/O model, a process performs I/O on just one file descriptor, named fd, at a time, and each I/O system call blocks until the data is transferred.
